sections.heading: of presentation of claims.Claims against a decedent's estate may be presented as follows:(1) The claimant may file a written statement of the claim, in the form prescribed by rule, with the clerk of the court
sections.text: The claim is deemed presented on the filing of the claim with the court. If a claim is not

sections.heading: 517(1) confers upon the county court exclusive original jurisdiction of all matters relating to the decedents' estates, including the probate of wills and the construction thereof, except as provided in section 30-2464(c) and this section
sections.text: Lenners v. St. Paul Fire & Marine Ins. Co., 18 Neb. App. 772
